intro: Upoxis, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to the Americas, particularly in arid and semi-arid regions. The plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in clusters. Upoxis species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions. They are generally herbaceous perennials, though some species may exhibit annual growth patterns.
